Articles.Content:
A few general guidelines on how to post an addon in a way that gets you the most hits


  • [li] Add Pictures - people like too see things before they download them... a .zip file by itself isn\'t very self-explanatory[/li]
    [li] Describe your work - a good description will go a long way - specially you your package includes a series of parts, people will appreciate it if you take the time to detail the contents of your pack[/li]
    [li] Keep it up to date - ensure that a working link to the most recent version of your work can be found at the first post of the thread - you can edit your posts at any time, and if all else fails, don\'t be shy in asking a moderator for help - that\'s what we\'re here for, anyways[/li]
    [li] Tag your pack folders - if you add your own prefix tag to the names of folders that are part of a parts pack, it\'ll be a lot easier for users to sort out their addons later on ( for maintenance, customizing, whatnot...), this is recomended for all addons to have, but specially so in case of multi-part packages[/li]

just a note to let you know that by trying to keep with these guidelines, your addons just may get that much more attention :thumbup:

:cheers:
